metadata.course_title: Interaction Design Project, 15 higher education credits
metadata.specialization: A1F, Second cycle, has second-cycle course/s as entry requirements

sections.Confirmation:
This course syllabus was confirmed by The IT Faculty Board on 2009-09-23 to be valid
from 2010-01-19.
sections.Position in the educational system:
The course is a part of the Computer Science Master's programme and a single subject
course at the University of Gothenburg.
The level for the course in relation to degree requirements is Master's degree, code A1F.
The course has course/courses at second cycle level as entry requirements.
The course can be part of the following programmes: 1) Computer Science, Master's
Programme (N2COS), 2) Computer Science, Bachelor's Programme (N1COS) and 3)
No translation available (NDATM)
sections.Entry requirements:
To be eligible for the course
students should have successfully completed a first year studies within the subject
Computer Science or equivalent. Specifically, the courses DIT860 Graphical Interfaces
and DIT880 Interaction Design Methodology or equivalent are required.
sections.Learning outcomes:
The course focuses on giving the students throughout training and experience from
interaction design work.
After completing the course the student is expected to be able to:
• Motivate and give the design rationale for decisions in an interaction design process
• Apply user evaluation methods in practice
• Apply design methods systematically
• Create and critically compare concept ideas
• Identify needs and requirements of specific intended user groups
• Predict the potential effects for all relevant stakeholders of a design
• Carry out a design project from concept to working prototype adhering to given
constraints
• Critique a design based on aesthetics and expression
• Present design proposals to a critical audience
• Present and document work through both oral and written presentations
sections.Course content:
The course aims at a deepened understanding of central design issues in interaction
design by means of practical training in design projects. In addition to creating working
prototypes, the course contains lectures, exercises and literature seminars. Design
projects are carried out in groups, under supervision. Progress reports and user tests are
made several times during the project and the results are presented at a concluding
public presentation.
sections.Form of teaching:
Language of instruction: English
The course is given in English.
sections.Assessment: The course is examined by a project.
sections.Grades: The grading scale comprises: Fail, Pass, Pass with distinction.
sections.Course evaluation:
The course is evaluated through meetings both during and after the course between
teachers and student representatives. Further, an anonymous questionnaire can be used
to ensure written information. The outcome of the evaluations serves to improve the
course by indicating which parts could be added, improved, changed or removed.
